intro: Everardia angusta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved everardia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish-white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
